ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Shows how to use UniformHeatmap with VerticalPeakDetector
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to create a [b]UniformHeatmap[/b] and use [b]Automatic Peak Detection[/b] to highlight peaks on dense heatmaps. This is useful when a heatmap dimensions exceed screen resolution. In this situation peaks may be lost because of heatmap compression. Setting the [b]AutoPeakDetection[/b] property on a [b]FastUniformHeatmapRenderableSeries[/b] turns on a peak detection algorithm to avoid this.
[b]Example Usage[/b]
Click 'PD' to enable or disable Automatic Peak Detection.
